perturbation.original_text: Both parties shall at all times while this Agreement is in effect and for one (1) year thereafter, at its expense, carry and maintain, at its own expense, insurance on all its operations necessary to comply with insurance laws as applicable.
perturbation.changed_text: Both parties shall maintain insurance on its operations.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrase 'at its expense, carry and maintain, at its own expense, insurance on all its operations necessary to comply with insurance laws as applicable,' the contract becomes vague about the necessity to comply with insurance laws. In Nevada, businesses are required to maintain specific insurance coverage to protect against potential liabilities. This change omits the explicit requirement to adhere to these laws, creating a legal contradiction. Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) 681A.010 et seq. details insurance regulations.

A party receiving a notice delivered personally shall sign a receipt therefore. Notices by U.S. Mail or facsimile transmission shall contain an acknowledgement of receipt. perturbation.changed_text:
Any notice, request, instruction or other documents permitted or required to be given hereunder by any party to the other parties shall be in writing as follows:

If to XLI: Bosch International 3753 Howard Hughes Parkway, Suite 200 Las Vegas, NV 89169 Attn: James Schramm Phone : (310) 871-4046

If to WCC: RMF Empire Inc. 2101 W. Empire Ave. Burbank, CA 91504 Attn: Ryan Friedlinghaus Phone: (818) 237-1287
perturbation.explanation: By removing the requirements for certified mail, return receipts, overnight courier, and acknowledgements, the contract weakens the enforceability of notice provisions. This introduces legal risk because it fails to ensure verifiable proof of notice delivery. California law (where WCC is located) and Nevada law (where XLI is located), generally require adequate notice for contract-related communications. Removing the acknowledgment requirements weakens the ability to prove such notice was given, creating potential legal disputes over breach of contract or termination.
perturbation.contradicted_law: California Civil Code ยง 1587; Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) 14.070

perturbation.changed_text: WCC shall indemnify XLI from claims arising out of: (i) the breach by WCC of any of the representations and warranties made by WCC in this Agreement or the failure by WCC to fulfill any of its covenants set forth herein, and (ii) the use by XLI of the WCC Trademarks pursuant to Section 1.1.1, above. Notwithstanding any other provision herein, WCC is not liable for claims arising out of the acts of XLI.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the phrases 'defend and hold harmless', 'and its respective affiliates, officers, directors, employees, agents and representatives', 'losses, damages, expenses, costs and other liabilities to any person or entity ("Claims") arising out of, relating to or in connection with', 'as approved by WCC' and 'negligent acts or omissions of XLI or third parties', the scope of indemnification is significantly narrowed, weakening XLI's protection against potential liabilities. While Nevada law allows parties to define indemnification obligations contractually, limiting the scope to only 'indemnify' without defense or hold harmless duties removes standard protections afforded under common law. This alteration can lead to legal disputes regarding the extent of WCC's responsibilities if XLI faces claims.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Common law principles of indemnification; Nevada Revised Statutes (NRS) 14.070
